summary: This is an FBI Crisis Intake form documenting a call from a former personal assistant to Jeffrey Epstein. The caller, who worked for Epstein in 1998, offered to disclose conversations with him about massages but would only speak directly to an FBI agent. The call was received by the FBI National Threat Operations Center regarding the child sex trafficking investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI investigation for child sex trafficking. The caller was his former personal assistant in 1998.

persons.name: Mrs. Maxwell
persons.context: Interviewed the caller for a job working for Jeffrey Epstein in 1998.

connections.description: Mrs. Maxwell interviewed job candidates for Epstein, indicating a working relationship.

events.title: Caller's Employment with Epstein
events.description: An individual worked as a personal/communications assistant for Jeffrey Epstein for two months.

events.title: FBI Crisis Intake Call
events.description: A former Epstein employee called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to provide information regarding the child sex trafficking case, offering to disclose conversations about massages.

keyFacts: A former personal assistant to Jeffrey Epstein contacted the FBI in July 2019 regarding the child sex trafficking investigation.
The assistant worked for Epstein for only two months in 1998 and was interviewed for the job by both Epstein and Mrs. Maxwell.
The caller stated she had conversations with Epstein about 'massages' but would only disclose details directly to an FBI agent.
The document is an FBI Crisis Intake form, indicating the information was formally logged for investigation.
